citation.title: Shining Light on Quantum Gravity with Pulsar-Black Hole Binaries

news.title: Fuzzy pulsars orbiting black holes could unmask quantum gravity
news.summary: Mark Garlick/SPL WANT to get to the bottom of one of the biggest mysteries in science? The best way might be to catch sight of a fast-spinning stellar corpse.

news.title: La gravitation quantique pourrait être testée grâce à un couple pulsar-trou noir supermassif
news.summary: La physique fondamentale du Big Bang, la gravitation quantique, pourrait se manifester tout proche de l'horizon des trous noirs en modifiant de façon caractéristique la propagation des ondes, qu'elles soient gravitationnelles ou électromagnétiques.

blogs.title: Shining Light on Quantum Gravity with Pulsar-Black Hole Binaries [CL]
blogs.summary:
http://arxiv.org/abs/1607.00018

    Pulsars are some of the most accurate clocks found in nature, while black holes offer a unique arena for the study of quantum gravity. As such, pulsar-black hole (PSR-BH) binaries provide ideal astrophysical systems for

blogs.title: Pulsars could probe black hole horizons
blogs.summary: The first antenna of MeerKAT,a SKA precursor in South Africa.[Image Source.]It’s hard to see black holes – after all, their defining feature is that they swallow light. But it’s also hard to discourage scientists from trying to shed light

author.name: Backreaction
author.description: Events on the world lines of two theoretical physicists, from the horizon to timelike infinity. A scientifically minded blog with varying amounts of entertainment, distractions, and every day trivialities.

blogs.title: Fuzzy pulsars orbiting black holes could unmask quantum gravity
blogs.summary: Random changes in the radio beam of a pulsar orbiting a black hole could be telltale quantum effects, giving us a way to test theories of quantum gravity
